meanings.definition: Baroceptors: sensory nerve endings that are stimulated by changes in pressure
meanings.sent1: The baroceptors in our bodies help us feel changes in pressure.
meanings.sent2: Doctors study baroceptors to understand how our bodies sense pressure.
meanings.sent3: The baroceptors must be having a party every time we go up in an elevator!
meanings.sent4: Her intuition acted like baroceptors, sensing the emotional pressure in the room.
meanings.sent5: The baroceptors, like tiny pressure detectives, send signals to our brain.

meanings.definition: Baroceptors: receptors that detect changes in pressure in the body
meanings.sent1: Baroceptors are like little pressure sensors in our bodies.
meanings.sent2: The baroceptors help us maintain our balance by detecting pressure changes.
meanings.sent3: I wonder if baroceptors can tell when a storm is coming.
meanings.sent4: His baroceptors were on high alert as he climbed higher up the mountain.
meanings.sent5: The baroceptors work tirelessly to keep us aware of pressure changes.
